basics.name: Micaiah Cape
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring 2026.

work.company: UH Manoa John A. Burns School of Medicine
work.summary: Migrating website content for the Department of Medicine.
highlights: Migrating the content of the Department of Medicine’s website from WordPress (platform it is currently hosted on) to Cascade (new platform).
Templated custom HTML and CSS if needed

work.summary: Created a web-based platform to aid in an NIH grant research project (project number 1DP2EB035858-01, $1.3m): using crowd-powered machine learning to diagnose developmental delays in adolescents from digital social interactions.
highlights: Used the Meteor.js framework to create a responsive website that hosts multiplayer games that users can interact with through the webcam.
Created multiplayer real-time video games using the HTML5 canvas.
Created social features on the website, such as a friending system.

work.company: UH Manoa, Department of Natural Resources & Environmental Management (NREM)
work.summary: Assisted the NREM office with various departmental tasks.
highlights: Processed and sorted graduate school applications, ran errands, answered phones, and replyed to and forwarded emails.

Assisted the head of the NREM department (Dr. Tomoaki Miura) with the programming aspects of his research projects. Primarily wrote shell scripts in Bash to sort massive amounts of files that will be used for the research projects.

volunteer.organization: John A. Burns School of Medicine, Department of Psychiatry
volunteer.summary: Conducted background research on substance use disorder. Published in scientific peer-reviewed journal articles and presented poster abstracts at local conferences.
highlights: Kiyokawa M, Kwon AK, Cape M, Streltzer JM. Kratom use disorder: case reports on successful treatment with home induction of buprenorphine-naloxone. Family Practice, 40(4), 596–598. doi: 10.1093/fampra/cmad081 (22.5% effort)

Cape M, Kiyokawa M, Haning W. Astronomical Use of Nitrous Oxide Associated with Stress From the COVID-19 Pandemic and Lockdown. The Primary Care Companion for CNS Disorders. doi: 10.4088/PCC.21cr03022. (45% effort)
Cape M, Kiyokawa M, Haning W. Olfactory Hallucination Associated With Benzodiazepine Withdrawal. Hawaii Addictions Conference, Online.

volunteer.summary: Helped to sort & distribute bags of food at my church. 3-hour monthly event.
practiced weekly and performed at the church average once every month.

awards.title: Regents Scholarship
awards.summary: A full-ride scholarship offered to Hawaii residents for 4 years. Awarded to support students with a record of outstanding academic achievement.

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Awarded to those who have accumulated a 3.5 GPA that semester. I was awarded every semester since admission.

awards.title: Valedictorian (class of 115)
awards.summary: Awarded to the person with the highest GPA out of the 2022 graduating class.
